title: (x) vintage fonts - Kaufmann, Futura, Orplid {Yves, Mark S}
content:
Please help me to identify these samples. I would like to use these or similar fonts to convey beauty, glamour, charm.   
   
Also does anyone have any recommendations for fonts that convey 1950's Hollywood glamour/movies/pin-up girls.   
   
if anyone knows any good links for vintage (50's) fonts or graphics please help. Thanks!   
   
 ![sample1](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49248.jpg)   
   
 ![sample2](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49249.jpg)
author: newbie_chez

comments.content:
Thank you!   
   
If anyone knows what the top one is, please post.
I couldn't find a digital version, but the top one I believe is Orplid.

Argh that is too bad, I can't find it either? Does this mean I'd have to find somewhere where I can use letterpress for this?   
   
Thanks anyway you guys.

Some links:   
   
 [font diner](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html)   
   
 [house industries](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.houseind.com/) especially Sign Painter, Las Vegas, Tikitype   
   
 [Jukebox](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.veer.com/products/vendor.aspx?vendor=JBT) from Veer   
   
You could do a search for "fifties" at [myfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=fifties)   
   
or at [fontscape](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.fontscape.com/explore?7EG)   
   
for starters

_Argh that is too bad, I can't find it either? Does this mean I'd have to find somewhere where I can use letterpress for this?_   
   
Well, It was originally a metal face, but I always remember seeing Orplid in rubdown/cutout lettering catalogs in the seventies. It was also available in phototype for headlines. It was pretty common in type catalogs so I gotta think somebody's digitized it by now but possibly given it a different name.

Regarding your samples, there's some [Kaufmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/kaufmann/kaufmann/testdrive.html?s=A%20Guide%20to%20Charm&p=36) in there   
as well as [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20110319160049/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/futura/book/testdrive.html?s=W%20I%20T%20H%20%20%20I%20L%20L%20U%20S%20T%20R%20A%20T%20I%20O%20N%20S%20%20%20B%20Y&p=24).
